title: 2014–15 in Israeli football
text:
The 2014–15 season was the 67th season of competitive <a href="Association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Israel">Israel</a>, and the 89th season under the <a href="Israeli%20Football%20Association">Israeli Football Association</a>, established in 1928, during the <a href="Mandatory%20Palestine">British Mandate</a>.
The season saw <a href="Maccabi%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Maccabi Tel Aviv</a> winning all three major trophies, the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Israeli%20Premier%20League">league</a>, the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Israel%20State%20Cup">State Cup</a> and the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Toto%20Cup%20Al">Toto Cup</a>, the first time all three trophies are won by one club during a season.
At the end of the season, Israel hosted the <a href="2015%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Under-19%20Championship">2015 UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship</a>, the fourth official tournament hosted by Israel (following the <a href="1964%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">1964 AFC Asian Cup</a>, the <a href="2000%20UEFA%20European%20Under-16%20Championship">2000 UEFA European Under-16 Championship</a> and the <a href="2013%20UEFA%20European%20Under-21%20Championship">2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship</a>), and the first ever women's football tournament was hosted by Israel.
